results.title: The Straight story
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Mary Sweeney, Neal Edelstein, FilmFour, Picture Factory and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: Richard Farnsworth is Alvin, a poor World War II veteran who, when hearing his estranged brother has suffered a stroke, decides to travel across the American mid-West to visit him. Alvin is a reformed alcoholic who feels heavily the guilt of what his alcoholism cost his wife and family. A magical road movie about human failure and human community, “The Straight Story” sees David Lynch forgo his usually dark and perverse examination of the libido and repression to instead concentrate on a story about human compassion and forgiveness. Lynch’s remarkably restrained direction allows the dignity of the story to come through without sliding into sentimentality. In this he his assisted by an excellent production staff that includes cinematographer Freddie Francis, production designer Jack Fisk, and editor Mary Sweeney. In “The Straight Story”, Lynch celebrates the rugged individualism of traditional rural American heroes, as represented by Western icon Farnsworth, but subversively suggests that this individualism must be tempered by the communal strengths of family, community and friendship. It may be a symptom of the degeneration of such values in contemporary Hollywood that Lynch had to rely on French and English money to finance this gentle and poetic road movie. Also features Harry Dean Stanton, and Sissy Spacek in a moving performance as Alvin’s daughter. Music by long term Lynch collaborator Angelo Badalamenti.

results.title: Shadows and fog
results.brief_description: The circus comes to town and fog covers a small European town as the locals, gripped by fear, band together to form vigilante groups to rid themselves of a strangler at large. Woody Allen plays a timid and fearful man who has been roped into one of the vigilante groups to find that he spends his time haplessly pitted against each faction within the vigilantes. A comedy of errors, ‘Shadows and Fog’ draws on its A-grade hollywood cast to create almost a disintegration of film epitomised by the bumbling incompetencies of Allen’s character who wanders alongide the main action like a narrator. The more the film follows Allen’s character the further we digress into a world of iconic noir references whilst quietly accompanied by some of Allen’s best gags. Cast includes Mia Farrow, John Malkovich, Donald Pleasence, Lily Tomlin, John Cusack, Jodie Foster, Kathy Bates, Fred Gwynne, Madonna and Woody Allen.

results.title: Love, honour and obey
results.creator_credit: Dominic Anciano, Ray Burdis, BBC and Fugitive Features
results.brief_description: Ray is the toughest gangster in North London, although he is preoccupied with thoughts of his upcoming marriage to Sadie and his favourite pastime, karaoke. Postman Jonny, bored with his job, wants to join Ray’s gang and enlists the help of his best friend, Jude, who also happens to be Ray’s nephew. Jude is unenthusiastic but sets up the meeting instead. Ray takes Jonny on, using his position as postman to steal credit cards. Jonny quickly becomes bored and, desperate for some real action, starts a feud between Ray’s gang and a tough South London gang. Cast includes Jonny Lee Miller, Jude Law, Ray Winstone, Sadie Frost and Rhys Ifans.

results.title: Encounters of the spooky kind
results.creator_credit: Samo Hung, Raymond Chow and Bo Ho Films
results.brief_description: Encounters of the Spooky Kind, directed by icon of kung-fu cinema Samo Hung, has been credited with establishing the unique horror sub-genre of hopping vampire films, most vividly demonstrated by the Mr. Vampire series. A bizarre blend of slapstick, martial arts and the supernatural, this film follows the adventures of Cheung the Brave, an impoverished cart driver plagued by bad luck and a shrewish wife who is conducting an affair with his wealthy boss, Master Tam. After narrowly avoiding being caught one afternoon, Tam resolves to have Cheung eliminated by having a man dare him to spend a night in a haunted temple, and then paying Chin Hoi, a corrupt Taoist sorcerer, to raise a vampire to kill him. Cheung, unable to resist both a dare and the chance to prove his bravery, accepts, but is saved from certain death by his kung-fu skills and the advice of the sorcerer’s brother Tsui, who decides to help him defeat those who were plotting against him. Utilising his superior kung-fu abilities and a variety of vampire deterrents including chicken eggs, uncooked rice and a brew of dog’s legs and blood, he manages to ward off the vampire for a second night, only to be framed for the alleged murder of his wife. Escaping, Cheung finds himself caught up in a feud that eventually culminates in an explosive magical showdown between the warring brothers. As the evil incantations fly, Cheung, possessed by the spirit of the Monkey God, and Master Tam, possessed by the War God, are pitted against each other in a supernatural duel to the death. Stars Samo Hung as Cheung the Brave, Ha Wong as Master Tam, Lung Chan as Chin Hoi, and Fat Chung as Tsui. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: One wild ride
results.creator_credit: Robert F. McGowan, Hal Roach and Hal Roach Studios
results.brief_description: Part of the “Our Gang” series. A comic tale of a taxi ride that ends up out of control. Cast includes Farina Hoskins, Mickey Daniels, Mary Kornman, Joe Cobb, Jackie Condon.

results.title: Bram Stoker's Dracula [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Charles Mulvehill, Fred Fuchs, American Zoetrope and Osiris Films
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s lavish new version of Bram Stoker’s classic novel is visually stunning, filled with images of both beauty and horror. James V. Hart’s screenplay sticks fairly close to Stoker’s novel although costuming and special effects give this film a very definite contemporary feel. Dracula is played brilliantly by Gary Oldman, and his arch-rival Dr. Van Helsing is played by Sir Anthony Hopkins. Cast also includes Winona Ryder and Keanu Reeves.

results.title: Out of sight [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Steven Soderbergh, ‘Out of Sight’ has been adapted from the novel of the same name by Elmore Leonard. When Jack Foley (George Clooney) robs a bank, his car breaks down and he is sent to a Florida prison. His escape attempt is witnessed by Federal Marshall Karen Sisco (Jennifer Lopez) who, as a result, is kidnapped by Foley’s partner, Buddy Bragg (Ving Rhames). Despite being on opposite sides of the law, Foley and Sisco discover their attraction to each other and Sisco is faced with a moral dilemma as she questions whether or not to turn him in.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Soderbergh, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher and Universal Pictures

results.title: American graffiti [DVD]
results.creator_credit: George Lucas, Francis Ford Coppola, Gary Kurtz, Coppola Co Productions and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
results.brief_description: This film from the director of the “Star Wars” trilogy is one of the most popular films of the 1970’s. The misadventures of four Californian teenagers on a late summer night in 1962, two of whom are leaving for college the next day, became the focal point for a trip back to the last “innocent” year of the 1960’s. Features a fine group of young actors who went on to become cinema and TV favourites, including Ron Howard, Richard Dreyfuss and Cindy Williams. The soundtrack features nostalgic hits from the heyday of Rock’n’Roll which takes the viewer back to a more innocent era when life was a lot less complicated. Don’t miss the great cameo appearance from Harrison Ford in the “toughest” role of his career.

results.title: Spartacus [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionnaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood.

results.title: Dr. Strangelove or How I learned to stop worrying and love the bomb [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, Victor Lyndon, Columbia and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: A crazy General, Jack D. Ripper, obsessed by the fear that the Communists are controlling the fluoridation of the U.S. water supply, unleashes his wing of H-bombers against Russia. The President of the United States, his Chiefs of Staff at the Pentagon and even the sinister Dr. Strangelove, realise it is too late to call off the attack so they await the awesome consequences. This controversial black comedy stars Peter Sellers in three separate roles; other stars include George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden and Slim Pickens. In turn hilarious, satirical and even terrifying, Dr. Strangelove is a guide on How To Stop Worrying and Love The Bomb.
